title: Śrī Nṛsiṁha Kavaca Stotram
author: Prahlāda Mahārāja (as recorded in the Brahmāṇḍa Purāṇa)
introduction: This is the potent protective hymn, the Śrī Nṛsiṁha Kavaca, as recited by Prahlāda Mahārāja. It begins with the Dhyāna (meditation) on the formidable yet compassionate form of Lord Nṛsiṁha, followed by the Kavaca proper (protective verses for the body and directions), and concludes with a verse of profound adoration and meditation on His divine acts.

chapters.name: Dhyāna, Rakṣā, and Phala (Meditation, Protection, and Results)
chapters.summary: The chapter includes the invocation, the Dhyāna ślokas describing the Lord's form, the aṅga-rakṣaṇa (protection of body parts), diśā-rakṣaṇa (directional protection) mantras, and the final Dhyāna/Praise verse.

verses.original:
नृसिंह-कवचं वक्ष्ये प्रह्लादेनोदितं पुरा ।
सर्व-रक्षा-करं पुण्यं सर्वोपद्रव-नाशनम् ॥
verses.transliteration:
nṛsiṁha-kavacaṁ vakṣye prahlādenoditaṁ purā
sarva-rakṣā-karaṁ puṇyaṁ sarvopadrava-nāśanam

translations.english: I shall now recite the Nṛsiṁha-kavaca, formerly spoken by Prahlāda Mahārāja. It is most pious, vanquishes all kinds of impediments, and provides one all protection.

verses.original:
सर्व-सम्पत्-करं चैव स्वर्ग-मोक्ष-प्रदायकम ।
ध्यात्वा नृसिंहं देवेशं हेम-सिंहासन-स्थितम् ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-saṁpat-karaṁ caiva svarga-mokṣa-pradāyakam
dhyātvā nṛsiṁhaṁ deveśaṁ hema-siṁhāsana-sthitam

translations.english: It bestows upon one all opulences and can give one elevation to the heavenly planets or liberation. One should meditate on Lord Nṛsiṁhadeva, Lord of the universe, seated upon a golden throne.

verses.original:
विवृतास्यं त्रि-नयनं शरद्-इन्दु-सम-प्रभम् ।
लक्ष्मि-आलिङ्गित-वामाङ्गं विभूतिभिर् उपाश्रितम् ॥
verses.transliteration:
vivṛtāsyaṁ tri-nayanaṁ śarad-indu-sama-prabham
lakṣmyāliṅgita-vāmāṅgaṁ vibhūtibhir upāśritam

translations.english: His mouth is wide open, and He has three eyes. He is as radiant as the autumn moon. His left side is embraced by mother Lakṣmīdevī, and His form is the shelter of all opulences, both material and spiritual.

verses.original:
चतुर्-भुजं कोमलाङ्गं स्वर्ण-कुण्डल-शोभितम् ।
श्रियासु शोभितोरस्कं रत्न-केयूर-मुद्रितम् ॥
verses.transliteration:
catur-bhujaṁ komalāṅgaṁ svarṇa-kuṇḍala-śobhitam
śriyāsu śobhitoraskaṁ ratna-keyūra-mudritam

translations.english: The Lord has four arms, and His limbs are very soft. He is decorated with beautiful golden earrings. His powerful chest is resplendent like the lotus flower, and His arms are decorated with jewel-studded ornaments.

verses.original:
तप्त-काञ्चन-सङ्काशं पीत-निर्मल-वाससम् ।
इन्द्रादि-सुर-मौलिस्थ स्फुरन् माणिक्य-दीप्तिभिः ॥
verses.transliteration:
tapta-kāñcana-sankāśaṁ pīta-nirmala-vāsasam
indrādi-sura-maulistha sphuran māṇikya-dīptibhiḥ

translations.english: He is dressed in a spotless yellow garment, which exactly resembles molten gold. He is the original cause of existence, beyond the mundane sphere. He is the crowning glory of the demigods such as Indra, the king of heaven. He is bedecked with rubies which are blazingly effulgent.

verses.original:
विराजित-पद-द्वन्द्वं शङ्ख-चक्रादि-हेतिभिः ।
गरुत्मता च विनयात् स्तूयमानं मुदान्वितम् ॥
verses.transliteration:
virājita-pada-dvandvaṁ śaṅkha-cakrādi-hetibhiḥ
garutmatā ca vinayāt stūyamānaṁ mudānvitam

translations.english: His feet are very attractive, and He is armed with various weapons such as the conch, chakra, and other divine weapons. He is always filled with great joy. Garuḍa constantly offers Him humble prayers with great reverence.

verses.original:
स्व-हृत्-कमल-संवासं कृत्वा तु कवचं पठेत् ।
नृसिंहो मे शिरः पातु लोक-रक्षार्थ-सम्भवः ॥
verses.transliteration:
sva-hṛt-kamala-saṁvāsaṁ kṛtvā tu kavacaṁ paṭhet
nṛsiṁho me śiraḥ pātu loka-rakṣātma-sambhavaḥ

translations.english: Having seated Lord Nṛsiṁhadeva upon the lotus of one’s heart, one should recite the following mantra: May Lord Nṛsiṁhadeva, who protects all the planetary systems, please protect my head.

verses.original:
सर्वगोऽपि स्तम्भ-वासः फालं मे रक्षतु ध्वनिम् ।
नृसिंहो मे दृशौ पातु सोम-सूर्याग्नि-लोचनः ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvago ’pi staṁbha-vāsaḥ phālaṁ me rakṣatu dhvanim
nṛsiṁho me dṛśau pātu soma-sūryāgni-locanaḥ

translations.english: Although the Lord is all-pervading, He hid Himself within a pillar. May He please protect my speech and the results of all my activities. May Lord Nṛsiṁhadeva, whose eyes are the sun, and fire, please protect my eyes.

verses.original:
स्मृतिं मे पातु नृहरिः मुनि-वर्य-स्तुति-प्रियः ।
नासां मे सिंह-नासस् तु मुखं लक्ष्मि-मुख-प्रियः ॥
verses.transliteration:
smṛtiṁ me pātu nṛhariḥ muni-varya-stuti-priyaḥ
nāsāṁ me siṁha-nāsas tu mukhaṁ lakṣmī-mukha-priyaḥ

translations.english: May Lord Nṛhari, who is pleased by the prayers offered by the best of sages, please protect my memory. May He who has the nose of a lion please protect my nose, and may He whose face is very dear to the goddess of fortune please protect my mouth.

verses.original:
सर्व-विद्याधिपः पातु नृसिंहो रसनां मम ।
वक्त्रं पात्व् इन्दु-वदनः सदा प्रह्लाद-वन्दितः ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-vidyādhipaḥ pātu nṛsiṁho rasanāṁ mama
vaktraṁ pātv indu-vadanaḥ sadā prahlāda-vanditaḥ

translations.english: May Lord Nṛsiṁhadeva, who is the knower of all sciences, please protect my sense of taste. May He whose face is as beautiful as the full moon and who is offered prayers by Prahlāda Mahārāja please protect my face.

verses.original:
नृसिंहः पातु मे कण्ठं स्कन्धौ भू-भरणा-अन्त-कृत् ।
दिव्यास्त्र-शोभित-भुजः नृसिंहः पातु मे भुजौ ॥
verses.transliteration:
nṛsiṁhaḥ pātu me kaṇṭhaṁ skandhau bhū-bharaṇānta-kṛt
divyāstra-śobhita-bhujaḥ nṛsiṁhaḥ pātu me bhujau

translations.english: May Lord Nṛsiṁhadeva please protect my throat. He is the sustainer of the earth and the performer of unlimitedly wonderful activities. His arms are resplendent with transcendental weapons. May He please protect my shoulders.

verses.original:
करौ मे देव-वरदो नृसिंहः पातु सर्वतः ।
हृदयं योगि-साध्यश् च निवासं पातु मे हरिः ॥
verses.transliteration:
karau me deva-varado nṛsiṁhaḥ pātu sarvataḥ
hṛdayaṁ yogi-sādhyaś ca nivāsaṁ pātu me hariḥ

translations.english: May the Lord, who bestows benedictions upon the demigods, please protect my hands, and may He please protect me from all sides. May He who is achieved by the perfect yogīs please protect my heart, and may Lord Hari please protect my dwelling place.

verses.original:
मध्यं पातु हिरण्याक्ष-वक्षः-कुक्षि-विदोरणः ।
नाभिं मे पातु नृहरिः स्व-नाभि-ब्रह्म-संस्तुतः ॥
verses.transliteration:
madhyaṁ pātu hiraṇyākṣa-vakṣaḥ-kukṣi-vidāraṇaḥ
nābhiṁ me pātu nṛhariḥ sva-nābhi-brahma-saṁstutaḥ

translations.english: May He who ripped apart the chest and abdomen of the great demon Hiraṇyakaśipu please protect my waist, and may Lord Nṛhari please protect my navel. He is offered prayers by Lord Brahmā, who has sprung from His own navel.

verses.original:
ब्रह्माण्ड-कोटयः कट्यां यस्य असौ पातु मे कटिम् ।
गुह्यं मे पातु गुह्यानां मन्त्राणां गुह्य-रूप-धृक् ॥
verses.transliteration:
brahmāṇḍa-koṭayaḥ kaṭyāṁ yasyāsau pātu me kaṭim
guhyaṁ me pātu guhyānāṁ mantrāṇāṁ guhya-rūpa-dhṛk

translations.english: May He, on whose hips rest all the universes please protect my hips. May the Lord please protect my private parts. He is the knower of all mantras and all mysteries, but He Himself is not visible.

verses.original:
ऊरू मनोभवः पातु जानुनी नर-रूप-धृक् ।
जङ्घे पातु धरा-भार-हर्ता योऽसौ नृ-केसरी ॥
verses.transliteration:
ūrū manobhavaḥ pātu jānunī nara-rūpa-dhṛk
jaṅghe pātu dharā-bhāra-hartā yo ’sau nṛ-kesarī

translations.english: May He who is the original Cupid please protect my thighs. May He who exhibits a human-like form please protect my knees. May the remover of the burden of the earth, who appears in a form of a half-man half-lion, please protect my calves.

verses.original:
सुर-राज्य-प्रदः पातु पादौ मे नृहरीश्वरः ।
सहस्र-शीर्षा-पुरुषः पातु मे सर्वशस् तनुम् ॥
verses.transliteration:
sura-rājya-pradaḥ pātu pādau me nṛharīśvaraḥ
sahasra-śīrṣā-puruṣaḥ pātu me sarvaśas tanum

translations.english: May the bestower of heavenly opulence please protect my feet. He is the Supreme Controller in the form of a man and lion combined. May the thousand-headed Supreme enjoyer please protect my body from all sides and in all respects.

verses.original:
महोग्रः पूर्वतः पातु महा-वीराग्रजोऽग्नितः ।
महा-विष्णुर् दक्षिणे तु महा-ज्वालस् तु नैर्ऋतौ ॥
verses.transliteration:
mahograḥ pūrvataḥ pātu mahā-vīrāgrajo ’gnitaḥ
mahā-viṣṇur dakṣiṇe tu mahā-jvālas tu nairṛtau

translations.english: May that most ferocious personality please protect me from the east. May He who is superior to the greatest heroes please protect me from the southeast, which is presided over by Agni. May the Supreme Viṣṇu please protect me from the south, and may that Supreme Person of blazing luster please protect me from the southwest.

verses.original:
पश्चिमे पातु सर्वेशो दिशि मे सर्वतो-मुखः ।
नृसिंहः पातु वायव्यां सौम्यां भीषणा-विग्रहः ॥
verses.transliteration:
paścime pātu sarveśo diśi me sarvatomukhaḥ
nṛsiṁhaḥ pātu vāyavyāṁ saumyāṁ bhīṣaṇa-vigrahaḥ

translations.english: May the Lord who is all-pervading please protect me from the west. His faces are everywhere, so may He please protect me from this direction. May Lord Nṛsiṁhadeva please protect me from the northwest, which is predominated by Vāyu, and may He whose form is in itself the supreme ornament please protect me from the north, where Soma resides.

verses.original:
ईशान्यां पातु भद्रो मे सर्व-मङ्गल-दायकः ।
संसार-भयतः पातु मृत्योर् मृत्युर् नृ-केसरी ॥
verses.transliteration:
īśānyāṁ pātu bhadro me sarva-maṅgala-dāyakaḥ
saṁsāra-bhayataḥ pātu mṛtyor mṛtyur nṛ-kesarī

translations.english: May the all-auspicious Lord, who Himself bestows all-auspiciousness, please protect me from the northeast, the direction of the sun-god. May He who is death personified please protect me from the fear of death and rotation in this material world.

verses.original:
गर्जनं गर्जयन्तं निज-भुज-पटलं स्फोटयन्तं हरन्तं ।
दीप्यन्तं तापयन्तं दिवि भुवि दिति-जं क्षेपयन्तं क्षिपन्तम् ।
क्रन्दन्तं रोषयन्तं दिशि दिशि सततं संहरन्तं भरन्तं ।
वीक्षन्तं घूर्णयन्तं कर-निकर-शतैर् दिव्य-सिंहं नमामि ॥
verses.transliteration:
garjantaṁ garjayantaṁ nija-bhuja-paṭalaṁ sphoṭayantaṁ harantaṁ
dīpyantaṁ tāpayantaṁ divi bhuvi ditijaṁ kṣepayantaṁ kṣipantam
krandantaṁ roṣayantaṁ diśi diśi satataṁ saṁharantaṁ bharantaṁ
vīkṣantaṁ ghūrṇayantaṁ kara-nikara-śatair divya-siṁhaṁ namāmi

translations.english: Lord Nṛsiṁhadeva roars loudly and causes others to roar. With His multitudes of arms, He tears the demons asunder and kills them in this way. He is always seeking out and tormenting the demoniac descendants of Diti, both on this earth planet and in the higher planets, and He throws them down and scatters them. He cries with great anger as He destroys the demons in all directions, yet with His unlimited hands He sustains, protects, and nourishes the entire cosmic manifestation. I offer my respectful obeisances to the Lord, who has assumed the form of a transcendental lion.
